item.title: TMC - Defects - Vegetation problem, 23rd July
item.description:
2 HOUR WITH GIVE AND TAKE PLEASE CLOSE BOTH ROAD AND FOOTWAY OF DUE TO A TREE UPROOTED AN ONLY LEANING ON A LAMP COLUMN NUMBER 12 (Damaged Tree)
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree is damaged problem, 23rd July
item.description:
There is a lovely chestnut tree outside my property, however in recent years it has become increasingly large and is causing damage to my property. I've had to have my drive re-laid due to the roots lifting it, the chestnuts falling from the tree cause damage to my car - which is parked on my drive - and the tree is hanging low over my driveway. I'd appreciate it if someone could assess and see if any work could take place to reduce it / move any overhang away from my property
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Very deep and dangerous pothole. Damaged my wheel and tore my tyre going very slow!, 23rd July
item.description:
Just off the mini roundabout, heading out of Tesco. Outside the gates on the left hand side. The roundabout is very damaged too.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Colletts Drive, Wymans Brook, Cheltenham

item.title: Inconsiderate people constantly abandoning vehicles on the bends, opposite junctions and in front of drop curbs etc., 23rd July
item.description:
All along Sapphire Road front the A435 roundabout to the play park. Cars parked opposite the junction for Cartmel Drive, Palm Court and Amber Road. All along and in front of the drop kerbs of the surgery, shops, and gym. This has been going on for 5 years. The planning for parking restrictions has been going on for over 6 months. Now this is being reviewed again and a new proposal isn't due until autumn or later! This is a very simple proposal. Just paint the yellow lines we all desperately want and need, before there is a fatality on this road.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Sapphire Road, Bishop's Cleeve
Report on FixMyStreet
